posts.post_content: What I like about this card is that it's useful both early and late game. Early game, it's a great chump blocker. Late game, it's great for it's discard ability (if I haven't discarded their hand already). 3.5 for flexibility in the field.

posts.post_content: This card's sorcery-speed activated ability starts to pay for itself after you've run out of [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot)s. Excellent with [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim), or [Liliana's Embrace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Embrace).

posts.post_content: I really would prefer the in-play discard part cost only 1B or 2B, and discard only one card. That would make it much more useful. You'd do discard as early as possible, not later.

Posted By: Cyberium (9/28/2010 1:57:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What do you expect for a mind rot on a stick???  
He's got cheap cmc... he can hit someone quick on turn 2...  
He's golden on turn 5 provided you get the mana...  
  
& if you've already got one out there late in the game but happen to end up with another ...   
BAM! knock out 4 from his hand with the other in your hand...   
with a [megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=megrim ) or [Liliana's Caress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Liliana's Caress) out there... ouch they're taking 8 potentially
posts.html:

Posted By: Shinigami-2099 (3/12/2011 8:07:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: As mentioned above, this card wrecks control players like it's nobody's business. Dismantling someone's hand for 7 mana that prevents counterspelling isn't bad on a card that's fine as a 1 cmc creature as well. When it's in play this card might as well be a flagbearer. It has to be dealt with, unless if you're fine with playing with no cards in hand.
posts.html:
